definition: to pluck/to pull off/to pull out/to unplug
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: If the operculum does not disappear, recommended treatment is extraction of the wisdom tooth.
sentences.chinese: 如果盲袋沒有消失，建議拔掉智齒。

sentences.english: Fouth, remember pull up the Battery plug after use.
sentences.chinese: 其四，電褥子使用完後要拔掉電源插頭。

sentences.english: No, I want to pluck eyebrows and do some makeup.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，我想拔掉眉頭，化點妝。

sentences.english: But if one can tear out completely the root of the thing ?
sentences.chinese: 但是假若人能徹底拔掉它的根部呢？

sentences.english: Jane got her bad tooth pulled out at the dentist's.
sentences.chinese: 簡在牙醫診所裏讓醫生把自己的壞牙拔掉了。

sentences.english: D: This tooth is too bad to be filled any more. It has to be pulled.
sentences.chinese: 這個牙齒壞得太厲害，已經不能補了，必須把它拔掉。

sentences.english: If you have naturally thick eyebrows just tweeze a little and thank the lord you have such lucky genes!
sentences.chinese: 如果你的眉毛很濃，就可以用鑷子拔掉一些。

sentences.english: Stop your horse at the gate and unlatch it.
sentences.chinese: 在門的前面停下你的馬，然後拔掉門閂。

sentences.english: When done, just unplug the hose.
sentences.chinese: 水放好後，只要拔掉水管就可以了。

sentences.english: Wisdom teeth that are not well aligned and become impacted are often removed.
sentences.chinese: 排列不齊和阻生的智齒通常要拔掉。

sentences.english: It is not surprising that they should seek to remove this thorn in their side.
sentences.chinese: 他們想拔掉這根肉中刺是不足爲怪的。

sentences.english: This is why these vestigial structures are almost always removed when they begin to come in.
sentences.chinese: 所以今天我們總是在它們剛剛開始長的時候就會拔掉。

sentences.english: How your gums have shrunk since your teeth were extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你的牙拔掉後，齒齦收縮了不少。

sentences.english: I got an abscess so he took the tooth out.
sentences.chinese: 我牙齦膿腫，所以他就把那顆牙拔掉了。

sentences.english: In east Africa, some people pull out their bottom teeth. They want their top teeth to stick out.
sentences.chinese: 在東非，有的人把下牙全部都拔掉，使上牙能突出來。

sentences.english: I had two teeth out this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我拔掉了兩顆牙齒。

definition: to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
to pull up by the roots/to uproot
to connect (a cable etc)/to hook up (a device)/to resume (a conversation)/to set (a bone)
to cut off/to cut away/to trim
to plug into/to insert/to stick in
to break/to sever/to turn off (electric switch)
bolt (for locking a window, cabinet etc)/(electrical) plug
